causal or efficient influence to bring about an effect or result
palm: the inner and somewhat concave part of the hand between the bases of the fingers and the wrist
a lineal measure equal either to the breadth of the hand or to its length from the wrist to the ends of the fingers
any symbol or token of superiority , success , or triumph
outfit: a fitting out , or equipment , as of a ship for a voyage , or of a person for an expedition in an unoccupied region or residence in a foreign land
the expense of , or allowance made for , equipment , as by the government of the united states to a diplomatic agent going abroad
any assemblage of objects required for or used in performing a task
things required as equipment for a task
a complete ensemble of clothing , selected to form a matching set
loaf: any thick lump , mass , or cake
a large regularly shaped or molded mass as of bread sugar or cake
theft: specifically , the felonious taking and removing of personal property , with an intent to deprive the rightful owner of the same
bath: the act of exposing the body , or part of the body , for purposes of cleanliness , comfort , health , etc
water or other liquid for bathing
a receptacle or place where persons may immerse or wash their bodies in water
a hebrew measure containing the tenth of a homer , or five gallons and three pints , as a measure for liquids
and two pecks and five quarts , as a dry measure
rider: one who , or that which , rides
one who breaks or manages a horse
puritan: one who is scrupulous and strict in his religious life
removal: the act of removing , or the state of being removed
bone: one of the pieces or parts of an animal skeleton
level: a line or surface to which , at every point , a vertical or plumb line is perpendicular
a line or surface which is everywhere parallel to the surface of still water
an approximately horizontal line or surface at a certain degree of altitude , or distance from the center of the earth
van: the first line or leading column
the front line or foremost division of a fleet either in sailing or in battle
a shovel used in cleansing ore
a light wagon , either covered or open , used by tradesmen and others for the transportation of goods
a large covered wagon for moving furniture , etc
a closed railway car for baggage
a fan or other contrivance , as a sieve , for winnowing grain
pay: an equivalent or return for money due , goods purchased , or services performed
salary or wages for work or service
fashion: the make or form of anything
the style , shape , appearance , or mode of structure
the prevailing mode or style , especially of dress
custom or conventional usage in respect of dress , behavior , etiquette , etc
particularly , the mode or style usual among persons of good breeding
kindness: the state or quality of being kind , in any of its various senses
manifestation of kind feeling or disposition beneficence
sentiment: a thought prompted by passion or feeling
a state of mind in view of some subject
feeling toward or respecting some person or thing
disposition prompting to action or expression
generally a decision of the mind formed by deliberation or reasoning
a sentence , or passage , considered as the expression of a thought
perfume: the scent , odor , or odoriferous particles emitted from a sweet - smelling substance
a substance that emits an agreeable odor
mountain: a large mass of earth and rock , rising above the common level of the earth or adjacent land
earth and rock forming an isolated peak or a ridge
an eminence higher than a hill
a range , chain , or group of such elevations
challenge: an invitation to engage in a contest or controversy of any kind
specifically , a summons to fight a duel
the letter or message conveying the summons
the act of a sentry in halting any one who appears at his post , and demanding the countersign
the opening and crying of hounds at first finding the scent of their game
ditch: any long , narrow receptacle for water on the surface of the earth
spin: velocity of rotation about some specified axis
an interpretation of an event which is favorable to the interpreter or to the person s / he supports
structure: arrangement of parts , of organs , or of constituent particles , in a substance or body
the arrangement of the different tissues or parts of animal and vegetable organisms
ability: the quality or state of being able
power to perform , whether physical , moral , intellectual , conventional , or legal
sufficiency of strength , skill , resources , etc
pain: suffering or evil inflicted as a punishment for crime , or connected with the commission of a crime
any uneasy sensation in animal bodies , from slight uneasiness to extreme distress or torture , proceeding from a derangement of functions , disease , or injury by violence
river: a large stream of water flowing in a bed or channel and emptying into the ocean , a sea , a lake , or another stream
a stream larger than a rivulet or brook
getting: the act of obtaining or acquiring
that which is got or obtained
glide: the act or manner of moving smoothly , swiftly , and without labor or obstruction
a transitional sound in speech which is produced by the changing of the mouth organs from one definite position to another , and with gradual change in the most frequent cases
correspondence: intercourse between persons by means of letters
mutual adaptation , relation , or agreement , of one thing to another
bitterness: the quality or state of being bitter , sharp , or acrid , in either a literal or figurative sense
deep distress , grief , or vexation of mind
a state of extreme impiety or enmity to god
dangerous error , or schism , tending to draw persons to apostasy
beginning: the act of doing that which begins anything
commencement of an action , state , or space of time
entrance into being or upon a course
the first act , effort , or state of a succession of acts or states
that which begins or originates something
captain: the military officer who commands a company , troop , or battery , or who has the rank entitling him to do so though he may be employed on other service
an officer in the united states navy , next above a commander and below a commodore , and ranking with a colonel in the army
massacre: the killing of a considerable number of human beings under circumstances of atrocity or cruelty , or contrary to the usages of civilized people
veranda: an open , roofed gallery or portico , adjoining a dwelling house , forming an out - of - door sitting room
dark: a place where there is little or no light
engineer: a person skilled in the principles and practice of any branch of engineering
one who manages as engine , particularly a steam engine
one who carries through an enterprise by skillful or artful contrivance
princess: a woman having sovereign power , or the rank of a prince
a female member of a royal family
suffrage: a vote given in deciding a controverted question , or in the choice of a man for an office or trust
the formal expression of an opinion
sounding: the act of one who , or that which , sounds ( in any of the senses of the several verbs )
orchestra: the space in a theater between the stage and the audience
the space in the main floor of a theater in which the audience sits
the forward spectator section of the main floor in distinction from the parterre which is the rear section of the main floor
the place in any public hall appropriated to a band of instrumental musicians
shot: discharge of a firearm or other weapon which throws a missile
a missile weapon , particularly a ball or bullet
specifically , whatever is discharged as a projectile from firearms or cannon by the force of an explosive
exempt: one of four officers of the yeomen of the royal guard , having the rank of corporal
ornament: that which adds grace or beauty
obstacle: that which stands in the way , or opposes
hostile: an american indian in arms against the whites
cut: an opening made with an edged instrument
a stroke or blow or cutting motion with an edged instrument
a stroke or blow with a whip
that which wounds the feelings , as a harsh remark or criticism , or a sarcasm
personal discourtesy , as neglecting to recognize an acquaintance when meeting him
tide: tendency or direction of causes , influences , or events
infamy: a quality which exposes to disgrace
song: that which is sung or uttered with musical modulations of the voice , whether of a human being or of a bird , insect , etc
a lyrical poem adapted to vocal music
consent: correspondence in parts , qualities , or operations
voluntary accordance with , or concurrence in , what is done or proposed by another
stealing: the act of taking feloniously the personal property of another without his consent and knowledge
thing: whatever exists , or is conceived to exist , as a separate entity , whether animate or inanimate
any separable or distinguishable object of thought
an inanimate object , in distinction from a living being
in scandinavian countries , a legislative or judicial assembly
blunder: a gross error or mistake , resulting from carelessness , stupidity , or culpable ignorance
blooming: the process of making blooms from the ore or from cast iron
separation: the act of separating , or the state of being separated , or separate
germ: that which is to develop a new individual
the earliest form under which an organism appears
invalid: a person who is weak and infirm
one who is disabled for active service
one in chronic ill health who is unable to care for himself
omen: an occurrence supposed to portend , or show the character of , some future event
any indication or action regarded as a foreshowing
bunch: a collection , cluster , or tuft , properly of things of the same kind , growing or fastened together
a small isolated mass of ore , as distinguished from a continuous vein
accusation: that of which one is accused
the charge of an offense or crime , or the declaration containing the charge
disadvantage: unfavorable or prejudicial quality , condition , circumstance , or the like
that which hinders success , or causes loss or injury
prejudice to interest , fame , credit , profit , or other good
scrub: one who labors hard and lives meanly
dragon: a fabulous animal , generally represented as a monstrous winged serpent or lizard , with a crested head and enormous claws , and regarded as very powerful and ferocious
a fierce , violent person , especially a woman
choir: a band or organized company of singers , especially in church service
that part of a church appropriated to the singers
awe: the emotion inspired by something dreadful and sublime
an undefined sense of the dreadful and the sublime
surveying: that branch of applied mathematics which teaches the art of determining the area of any portion of the earth ' s surface , the length and directions of the bounding lines , the contour of the surface , etc
the act or occupation of making surveys
tear: a drop of the limpid , saline fluid secreted , normally in small amount , by the lachrymal gland , and diffused between the eye and the eyelids to moisten the parts and facilitate their motion
something in the form of a transparent drop of fluid matter
a partially vitrified bit of clay in glass
the act of tearing , or the state of being torn
worst: that which is most bad or evil
the most severe , pernicious , calamitous , or wicked state or degree
state: the circumstances or condition of a being or thing at any given time
brood: the young birds hatched at one time
the young from the same dam , whether produced at the same time or not
young children of the same mother , especially if nearly of the same age
that which is bred or produced
candle: a slender , cylindrical body of tallow , containing a wick composed of loosely twisted linen of cotton threads , and used to furnish light
page: in the united states , a boy or girl employed to wait upon the members of a legislative body
a contrivance , as a band , pin , snap , or the like , to hold the skirt of a woman ' s dress from the ground
one side of a leaf of a book or manuscript
contemplation: the act of the mind in considering with attention
continued attention of the mind to a particular subject
the act of looking forward to an event as about to happen
symbol: a visible sign or representation of an idea
anything which suggests an idea or quality , or another thing , as by resemblance or by convention
any character used to represent a quantity , an operation , a relation , or an abbreviation
an abstract or compendium of faith or doctrine
a creed , or a summary of the articles of religion
baron: a title or degree of nobility
iginally , the possess of a fief , who had feudal tenants under him
in modern times , in france and germany , a nobleman next in rank below a count
in england , a nobleman of the lowest grade in the house of lords , being next below a viscount
teacher: one whose business or occupation is to instruct others
one who instructs others in religion
meet: the persons who so assemble and the place of meeting
